text:
Hi :wave:

I am currently using the HubSpot PHP SDK to create and update Schemas within HubSpot. One thing I am having trouble with is updating Schema properties (updating a properties label, adding new properties to an existing Schema etc...). I was wondering if it was possible, or is it that once the Schema has been created, the properties can't be updated?

> If you create a page via the API and publish it — then perform a GET call on it, it doesnt show up with a `layoutSections` prop?
Exactly.

What _doesn't_ fill a `layoutSections` property:
• `PATCH /draft` then `POST /draft/push-live`
• publishing the page (by hand or API)
I'm at loss finding an automated way to do this :confused:
Morning Guys, it's posible to get all the columns for the API Lines?
The columns with the Yellow arrow

Hello, I have a quick question. I followed this instruction "<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#handling-action-hooks>" and everything worked so far to create a new CRM card.  But I see only one problem and I hope you guys can help me here. I added an a "primaryAction" to my widget with the "type": "iframe" within this action I create an entry in our platform but after this step was finished and the iframe was closed the CRM card is not reloaded automatically. Did I miss any option here to refresh my CRM card after I opened an iframe dialog or after I triggered an action?
Is there a way to distinguish an associated company as the primary company through the API?

Hi <@UFBNA9K9A>
I see the "e-commerce" scope for oauth2.0 is available only to professionals and enterprises.
but HubSpot line items can be accessed in the starter edition plan, does it mean we can use "e-commerce" scope in starter as well to fetch line items via API call ??

and also how should I use tax field under product library, not able to add it from UI.

Hi everyone
what was the exact difference b/w below two scopes, what purpose it can help in API calls, can anyone help me out.
```"crm.objects.contacts.read"  and "crm.schemas.contacts.read"```
